com.honeywell.mobility.print

Class Printer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.honeywell.mobility.print.Printer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LabelPrinter, LinePrinter

    public abstract class Printer
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class implements common functionality for communicating with a Honeywell printer.
    Since:
    1.30

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Printer.ExtraSettings
      This class defines extra settings that may be required for creating an object of a concrete subclass of Printer.

    • Method Detail

      • addPrintProgressListener

        public void addPrintProgressListener(PrintProgressListener aHandler)
        Adds the specified listener to receive print progress events from the concrete class object.
        Parameters:
        aHandler - An object that implements the PrintProgressListener interface.
        See Also:
        removePrintProgressListener(PrintProgressListener), PrintProgressEvent, PrintProgressListener

      • close

        public void close()
           throws PrinterException
        Closes the existing printer connection and releases the resources this object uses. If you do not call this method, the resources will not be freed until this object is garbage collected. If you attempt to call other member methods after this method call, a PrinterException will be thrown.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an error occurs in closing the connection to the printer.

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws PrinterException
        Opens a connection to the printer identified in the concrete class constructor. After the connection is successfully opened, it sends the commands specified in the Initialize and NormalFont settings to the printer. These settings are defined in the commands and attributes file or string specified in the concrete class constructor. The first command sent to the printer would trigger a PrintProgressEvent with a message type of PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.STARTDOC.

        The application must call this method to connect to the printer before invoking other methods to interact with the printer; otherwise, a PrinterException will be thrown.

        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an error occurs in opening the connection to the printer.

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
                   throws PrinterException
        Closes the existing printer connection. This method may fire several PrintProgressEvent events with different message types. If the endDoc() method has not been called since the document was started, the events are fired in the the following order:
        • PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.ENDDOC
        • PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.FINISHED
        • PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.COMPLETE

        Note: The event with the PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.COMPLETE message type is only fired if the document has been completely printed without errors or being cancelled.

        If the endDoc() method was called to indicate the end of the document and a new document has not been started, only one event is fired with the PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.FINISHED message type.

        Returns:
        A Boolean 'true' indicates that the printer connection was closed, or 'false' indicates that the method was called without an open connection
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an error occurs in closing the connection to the printer.

      • endDoc

        public void endDoc()
            throws PrinterException
        Indicates the end of the document and causes one or more PrintProgressEvent events to be fired. The events are fired in the following order:
        • PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.ENDDOC
        • PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.COMPLETE

        Note: The event with the PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.COMPLETE message type is only fired if the document has been completely printed without errors or being cancelled.

        If the application does not close the printer connection via the disconnect() method after this method call, the next command or data sent to the printer would trigger a PrintProgressEvent with a message type of PrintProgressEvent.MessageTypes.STARTDOC.

        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws PrinterException
        Sends all the data in the internal print buffer to the printer via the transport medium. Once the printer receives the data, it may not immediately print the data. For many printers this is forced by sending a line feed character.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an error occurs in sending the text to the printer or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.

      • formFeed

        public void formFeed()
              throws PrinterException
        Sends the printer FormFeed command to the printer, causing it to feed paper. This method also flushes the internal print buffer.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an error occurs in sending the command to the printer or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.

      • getBytesWritten

        public int getBytesWritten()
                    throws PrinterException
        Gets the number of bytes sent to the printer since the last connect() call.
        Returns:
        An integer value for the number of bytes sent to the printer since the last connect call.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.

      • getStatus

        public int[] getStatus()
                throws PrinterException
        Gets the current state of printer attributes like paper condition and battery voltage. To use this method, you must define the query command to send to the printer and the patterns to search in the printer response. Each pattern is associated with a message number. When a matching pattern is found, its message number is returned in the integer array. The returned value of the getStatus method is an array because it may hold multiple message numbers if multiple errors were detected. The standard printer_profiles.JSON file provided by the Honeywell Mobility Android Printing SDK contains predefined entries for ESC/P status queries.
        Returns:
        An array of integer values representing the status messages returned by the printer.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.

      • removePrintProgressListener

        public void removePrintProgressListener(PrintProgressListener aHandler)
        Removes the specified listener so that it no longer receives print progress events from the concrete class object.
        Parameters:
        aHandler - An object that implements the PrintProgressListener interface.
        See Also:
        addPrintProgressListener(PrintProgressListener), PrintProgressEvent, PrintProgressListener

      • sendCustomCommand

        public void sendCustomCommand(java.lang.String aCommandID)
                       throws PrinterException
        Sends a custom command identified by the specified command identifier to the internal print buffer. The contents of the internal buffer is sent to the printer via the transport medium when the buffer is full or when a call to flush() or LinePrinter.newLine(int) is made.

        The aCommandID parameter specifies a setting name defined in the current printer settings. The command setting value must be a string or a byte array. For example, the following setting defines a slogan with a bold-on sequence in the front and a bold-off sequence at the end. 

         "MySlogan" : "\u001bwmSave Time and Money at MYSTORE.com\u001bw!"
        When you call sendCustomCommand("MySlogan"), it sends "\u001bwmSave Time and Money at MYSTORE.com\u001bw!" to the internal print buffer to be printed.

        You may define custom commands in the commands and attributes file or string specified in the concrete class constructor, or add custom commands via the setSettingBytes and setSettingString methods.

        Parameters:
        aCommandID - A string containing the name of a setting in the current printer settings.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if the specified command identifier is null or does not exist in the current printer setting, or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.
        See Also:
        setSettingBytes(java.lang.String, byte[]), setSettingString(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • setSettingBool

        public void setSettingBool(java.lang.String aSettingName,
                  boolean aBoolValue)
                    throws PrinterException
        Adds the specified boolean setting to the current printer settings if the setting name does not already exists; otherwise, the existing setting value will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        aSettingName - A string containing the setting name.
        aBoolValue - A Boolean setting value.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • setSettingBytes

        public void setSettingBytes(java.lang.String aSettingName,
                   byte[] aBytesValue)
                     throws PrinterException
        Adds the specified byte array setting to the current printer settings if the setting name does not already exists; otherwise, the existing setting value will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        aSettingName - A string containing the setting name.
        aBytesValue - A byte array for the setting value.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • setSettingNum

        public void setSettingNum(java.lang.String aSettingName,
                 int aIntValue)
                   throws PrinterException
        Adds the specified integer setting to the current printer settings if the setting name does not already exists; otherwise, the existing setting value will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        aSettingName - A string containing the setting name.
        aIntValue - An integer setting value.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • setSettingString

        public void setSettingString(java.lang.String aSettingName,
                    java.lang.String aStrValue)
                      throws PrinterException
        Adds the specified string setting to the current printer settings if the setting name does not already exists; otherwise, the existing setting value will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        aSettingName - A string containing the setting name.
        aStrValue - A string containing the setting value.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • startFileEcho

        public void startFileEcho(java.lang.String aFilePath,
                 boolean clearFile)
                   throws PrinterException
        Enables the file echo feature. When this feature is active, all data that is sent to the internal print buffer will also be sent to the specified file for debugging purposes. Androie note: The output file needs to be on the external storage. Honeywell recommends that you use the android.content.Context.getExternalFilesDir(String) method to get the absolute path to the directory on the external storage pertaining to the application.

        Parameters:
        aFilePath - A string containing the file path of the file that will receive the echoed commands.
        clearFile - A Boolean 'true' value indicates that the file should be deleted if it already exists or 'false' to append to the existing file.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • stopFileEcho

        public void stopFileEcho()
                  throws PrinterException
        Disables the file echo feature. When this feature is disabled, data sent to the internal print buffer will no longer be copied to the echo file for debugging purposes.

        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] bytes)
           throws PrinterException
        Writes an array of bytes to the internal print buffer. The data is sent to the printer via the transport medium when the internal buffer is full or when a call to flush() or LinePrinter.newLine(int) is made.
        Parameters:
        bytes - An array of bytes to be written to the internal print buffer.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String aStr)
           throws PrinterException
        Writes a string to the internal print buffer. The string is converted to ASCII character data before writing to the buffer. The contents of the internal buffer is sent to the printer via the transport medium when the buffer is full or when a call to flush() or LinePrinter.newLine(int) is made.
        Parameters:
        aStr - A string to be written to the internal print buffer.
        Throws:
        PrinterException - if an unexpected error occurs or if an active connection to the printer does not exist.
